terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to view revision history, compare versions, and revert to previous states.
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and share data with each other.
A single, unified storage location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed, providing a single source of truth for teams.
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously, with changes visible instantly to all participants.
The use of software to automatically execute business processes and tasks without manual intervention, reducing errors and improving efficiency.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, essential for compliance and accountability.
A security system that grants or restricts user access to features and content based on their assigned role or position within an organization.
A centralized location where all authoritative and up-to-date information is stored, ensuring everyone accesses the same accurate data.
Detailed written materials that explain how systems, processes, or equipment work, including specifications, manuals, and procedural guides.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies.
Pre-designed document formats with standardized structure, formatting, and content sections that ensure consistency across similar documents.
A detailed log of all changes made to a document over time, including who made changes, when they were made, and what was modified.
The process of combining data from different sources and systems into a unified view, often through automated connections and APIs.
Automated processes that route documents through predetermined review and approval steps before they are finalized or published.
A software system designed to create, store, organize, and maintain documents and technical content throughout their lifecycle.
